Built-in account for administering the computer/domain

TCP port 445 is used for direct TCP/IP MS Networking access without the need for a NetBIOS layer or firewalls. As a safety measure always block this port first, if it is currently open. Port 139 is used for file and printer sharing. Because it is widely used for this purpose, it is also frequently attacked from outside making this port a critical vulnerability on the internet. Ref: https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1135/
Opened sharing of network resources over Port 445
Opened sharing of network resources over Port 445
Close port 445 to prevent network sharing.
Remove user newly downloaded suspicious executables.
Disabling it if it is not actively used
The system has a HomeGroupUser$ account. We suggest disabling it if it is not actively used. Ref: https://www.itprotoday.com/security/windows-guest-account-best-practices

The Network Communication Protocol NetBIOS over TCP/IP is not disabled on the system. An attacker could use a command-line network utility tool such as the NBTSTAT command to read sensitive information such as the NetBIOS information and the MAC address of your network card. To prevent this, we recommend disabling this protocol. Ref: CVE-2018-8335, (https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2018-8335/)
